qas.question: Which war gave birth to al-Qaeda?
When did the Soviets leave Afghanistan?
Which countries supported Afghan islamists against the Soviets?

answers.text: United States, United Kingdom, Saudi Arabia, Pakistan, and the People's Republic of China

qas.question: Who did Osama bin Laden volunteer to help fight in the 80s?

answers.text: World Islamic Front for Jihad Against Jews and Crusaders

qas.question: What took place from February 1979 to December 1989?

plausible_answers.text: World Islamic Front for Jihad Against Jews and Crusaders

qas.question: What group started forming in February 1996?
What did Osama bin Laden sign in May 1998?
Who did Osama bin Laden declare war against in a February 1998 video?

plausible_answers.text: World Islamic Front for Jihad Against Jews and Crusaders

qas.question: What is the WIJFAJC also known as?
What war did al-Qaeda start in 1979?

plausible_answers.text: World Islamic Front for Jihad Against Jews and Crusaders (WIFJAJC)

qas.question: What document declared war on the Soviet Union?
Who volunteered to fight with the Islamist Afghan mujahadeen guerillas?

context: The origins of al-Qaeda can be traced to <a0_0><b10_0>the <b5_0>Soviet war in Afghanistan<b10_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> (December 1979 – <a1_0>February 1989<a1_0/>). The <a2_0>United States, United Kingdom, Saudi Arabia, Pakistan, and the People's Republic of China<a2_0/> supported the Islamist Afghan mujahadeen guerillas against the military forces of the Soviet Union and the Democratic Republic of Afghanistan. A small number of "<b14_0>Afghan Arab<b14_0/>" volunteers joined the fight against the <a3_0>Soviets<a3_0/>, including Osama bin Laden, but there is no evidence they received any external assistance. In May 1996 the group <a4_0><b6_0><b9_0><b11_0>World Islamic Front for Jihad Against Jews and Crusaders<b9_0/><b6_0/><a4_0/> (WIFJAJC)<b11_0/>, sponsored by bin Laden (and later re-formed as <b12_0>al-Qaeda<b12_0/>), started forming a large base of operations in Afghanistan, where the Islamist extremist regime of the Taliban had seized power earlier in the year. In February 1998, Osama bin Laden signed <b7_0>a <b13_0>fatwā<b13_0/><b7_0/>, as head of al-Qaeda, declaring war on the West and Israel, later in May of that same year al-Qaeda released a video declaring war on the <b8_0>U.S. and the West<b8_0/>.
